text: NORMA LEWIS (31) sits up in bed. The soft glow of the lam casts her in silhouette. Her husband, ARTHUR LEWIS (30), next to her.
Did you hear something?
The doorbell.
Are you sure that was the doorbell? From down below... the DOORBELL rings again.
Yep. Norma retrieves her WATCH from the bedside table.
What time is it?
Quarter ‘til five. Norma gets out of bed and throws on her bathrobe. Arthur sits up, hair sticking up in every direction. He h sideburns that run down the side of his face like daggers

Norma comes down the stairs and approaches the front door She looks through the PEEPHOLE. Through the PEEPHOLE... she glimpses a BLACK SEDAN idling the street. It quickly drives off. Norma unlatches the DEAD BOLT and opens the door. She not something at her feet.  Someone has left a CARDBOARD BOX on the front step. It's dimensions are 1’ x 1’ xl’. She leans down and picks up the box, noticing that it has been meticulously sealed with clear tape. There are no markings on it whatsoever. Norma looks down the quiet, empty street. She quickly clo the door and turns inside and away from the cold air. Arthur arrives at the bottom of the stairs.
What is it?
Someone left a box.
Who?
I don't know. There was a car waiting... but they drove off. Norma hands the box to Arthur. He examines it.
Is that one of my Christmas presents? Their young son, WALTER LEWIS (9), is standing at the top the stairs. He is dressed in his pajamas. His parents just stare back at him in silence.

The Lewis family has now moved into the kitchen. WRAPPING PAPER and CHRISTMAS ORNAMENTS are scattered across the ta Norma is pouring COFFEE. Arthur is cutting through the ta that seals the box with a knife while Walter looks on eagerly.
Should I close my eyes?

Maybe... it’s up to you. Arthur opens the lid and sees that there are FOAM PEANUTS inside. He digs down and retrieves a WOODEN BOX. Its dimensions are 8” x 8” x 8”. The box is made of WHITE ORK with a clear varnish. Mount top is a CLEAR GLASS DOME attached to a lid with a HINGE MOUNT. Inside of the dome is a CYLINDRICAL METAL BUTTON.
Is there a note? Arthur reaches inside the box and retrieves a_ small WHIT ENVELOPE. Printed on the envelope in CALLIGRAPHY is the n
It's for you, Norma. Norma opens the envelope and removes a folded piece of wh stationary. Printed in elegant calligraphy is a single sentence: MR. STEWARD WILL CALL UPON YOU AT O PM.
Mr. Steward will call upon you at 5 PM. (to herself) Do I know a Mr. Steward? Arthur yawns.
I dunno. You tell us.
Arthur is now showered and shaven, dressed for work. He a Walter sit at the kitchen table, waiting for Norma to del breakfast. The box sits on the table between them. Arthur opens up the newspaper.

text: Arthur turns the page.
What kind of car was it?
Z couldn't see. It was dark and T didn't have my contacts in.
Why would they just drive off?
I don’t know. But the bus will be here if five minutes... so eat.
Norma and Walter emerge from the house onto the front por She hands him his LUNCH BOX and a WINTER HAT. SNOW has be to fall from the sky.
Last day of school and now it starts to snow?!
Put on your hat... A young girl, DANA (13) is waiting at the end of the sidewalk. She is wrapped head-to-toe in warm clothes... EARMUFFS and SCARF around her neck.
(muffled through scarf) Hi Mrs. Lewis.
Good morning, Dana. (shivering) And please call me Norma. You're making me feel old.
You are old!
I’m thirty-one!
To us that's old! You’re a geezer!
Well you'll be a geezer one day too, smarty-pants.  Norma closes her eyes, taking in a breath of cold air. Snowflakes land in her face and hair. Walter sighs... looking at his watch.
Why does the bus stop have to be at the end of our driveway?
(high-pitched) So I can watch my little Walter get on his bus... safe in one piece! Down the street, A SCHOOL BUS begins to crest the hill... fast approaching...
Please. Go. Inside. You’re embarrassing me.
My love embarrasses you?
Yes. Yes it does. She begins to walk down the sidewalk... taunting him as t bus approaches.
What if I give little Walter a little kiss in front of all his friends on the school bus? Dana’s eyes widen. A MISCHIEVOUS GRIN emerges from behind scarf that covers the lower part of her face.
Do it! The bus is fast approaching... brakes squealing as it slo to a stop.

Don't come any closer! Norma gives him a big HUG and a KISS right as the bus doo open. A bunch of OLDER KIDS stare out the window... scowl at him. Walter pushes away from her and stomps up onto the bus... mortified. Dana follows him.
Dana... you're baby-sitting for us tonight, right?
Eight o'clock?
Eight o'clock.
Okay. Dana gets on the bus. BUD WALL (30s), the bus driver, smi at Norma. He is an enormous giant of a man with a shaved head.
Bus-Driver Bud! Merry Christmas...
Our last day!
I know!
It‘ll all be over soon, Norma. He stares at her for a moment that is almost too long... shuts the doors to the bus.

Arthur sits at the table... reading the morning paper. The CAMERA zooms into the COMICS SECTION... revealing the panels of the comic strip REX MORGAN, MD. Arthur begins reading the voices of REX MORGAN and his girlfriend JUNE.
(as Rex Morgan) Do you realize that this is the first time in my life that I will be taking more than a week's vacation, June? Norma arrives in the kitchen. She now has a slight limp.
{as June, hi-pitched) And enjoy it! Don't worry about the office!
Rex Morgan... I need you back here no later than seven. Rehearsal dinner starts at eight. Arthur grabs his BRIEFCASE and a BASKETBALL.
The Viking Squad has a game at four.
Don't get stuck in Friday traffic...
Okay June. He starts bouncing the ball on the kitchen floor. She grabs the ball in mid bounce... annoyed with him.
Not in the house!
How’s your foot?

It's fine. She pushes him toward into the FAMILY ROOM...- opening th door that leads out to the garage. They exit the house and the CAMERA drifts back toward the kitchen table... moving in toward the box.

The GARAGE DOOR opens and both of the LEWIS FAMILY CARS b out at the same time, almost choreographed in perfect uni Arthur drives a SILVER 1975 PONTIAC TRANS-AM. Norma drive WHITE 1976 OLDSMOBILE STATION WAGON with WOOD WALLS. They pull out onto MONUMENT AVENUE, cars pointing in oppo directions. Arthur rolls down his window.
It’s your Christmas present.
From you?
From your secret lover. (beat) Mr. Steward. She furrows her brow.
(sarcastic) I hate you, Rex Morgan MD.
(playful) I hate you, too.
Don’t be late tonicht.

I've got your present at work. It’s almost finished. He smiles... then peels off down Monument Ave. From Norma’s REAR VIEW MIRROR... Arthur's car disappears the road. She reaches up to re-adjust... her eyes appear the mirror's reflection. INSERT: Norma’s VIRGINIA license plate. The Oldsmobile drives down the street in the opposite direction.
HELICOPTER SHOT: The CAMERA crests over the barren WINTER FOREST on the southeast side of the city... tipping up to reveal DOWNTOWN RICHMOND, VIRGINIA.

It's twenty-three degrees on this December morning here in Richmond... The CAMERA moves over the DOWNTOWN EXPRESSWAY... heavy traffic moves in either direction. The CAMERA approaches the side of ARTHUR’S TRANS-AM as it crests around the INTERSTATE EXCHANGE onto ROUTE 64 at th HISTORICAL CLOCK TOWER of MAIN STREET TRAIN STATION.

The French government, in what was seen here as a gesture to President— elect Jimmy Carter, announced Thursday a further tightening of controls over the exportation of nuclear technology. The CAMERA swoops down alongside the driver's side of Arthur’s car... moving into the SIDE VIEW MIRROR. His fac reflected in the mirror... listening to the radio as he begins his southbound commute to work.
The CAMERA pulls back from a sign at the entrance to COLLEGIATE... an exclusive PRIVATE SCHOOL. Norma’s STATIO WAGON pulls into the school parking lot.

The CAMERA tracks with Norma as makes her way through the CROWDED HALLWAY... filled with LOUD TEENAGERS from the ag 9-18. Her limp. has gotten worse. She WINKS at someone... then turns a corner and the CAMER whips around to reveal WALTER standing at his locker. He closes the door, revealing Dana and another friend named CHARLES (12) standing there.
Why does your mom limp?
Yeah... is something wrong with her foot?
That's none of your business.
Dana saw her take her shoe off in the parking lot yesterday.
There’s definitely something wrong with her foot. It looks mangled.

You didn’t say mangled... you said it looked gross. Walter lunges at Charles and pushes him up against the locker... awkwardly trying to fight him.  10. They continue to wrestle awkwardly for a moment against t lockers and then Walter lets go... backing away.
If you ever make fun of my mom again I‘ll kill you! Walter storms off down the hall.
The CAMERA moves through the SCHOOL OFFICE as teachers an RECEPTIONISTS move about in preparation for the last day, approaching a FROSTED GLASS DOOR that reads:
INT. COLLEGIATE SCHOOL -- PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE -- NEXT Norma sits across from the desk of WILLIAM POATES (45), t principal of the school.
The uhhh... the board came to a vote last week, so it’s official. They've officially cancelled the faculty tuition discount.
So what does that mean for me?
You're going to have to start paying full tuition for your son.
Starting when?
Next semester. Norma notices a SMALL DROP of BLOOD forming in his right nostril.
Okay.
I’m real sorry about this, Norma.  ii.
Yeah, me too. I've got three weeks to figure out how to tell my son we can't afford to send him to Collegiate any more. The drop of blood has begun to flow down onto his upper l
Like I said, I’m real sorry.
Yeah... your nose is bleeding. Poates reaches for his HANDKERCHIEF and puts it to his fa wiping off the blood. The MORNING BELL rings.
Norma walks hurriedly down the empty hallway. Her limp ha gotten worse as the morning grind has now begun.
Norma comes into her CLASSROOM... a SCIENCE LAB with SINK and BUNSEN BURNERS mounted in MARBLE TOP DESKS. Kids are moving about... loud and rambunctious.
Okay... everyone quiet down! Take your seats! Norma moves toward a stack of METAL TRAYS on her desk. In of each tray is a BALL OF BLACK MUSH.
Today is the day many of you have been eagerly awaiting. You get to dissect owl pellets. A MALE STUDENT (13) pumps his fist...
Yes! Norma sets an OWL PELLET down in front of a FEMALE STUDEN (12). She looks at the owl pellet in disgust.
This is so gross. Norma sets a tray down in front of Charles.  12.
Why do they call it an owl pellet? A MALE STUDENT (12) next to him takes his tray from Norma
Because they shit out of their mouths.
Hey... watch the language. You say another cuss word I’ve gotta send you to detention, okay?
Sorry, Mrs. Lewis.
Is it true?
Is what true?
That owls poo out of their mouths.
Yes... this is true. The classroom gasps in disgust... others laugh.

Grey forest owls feed upon field mice, squirrels and small birds. The owl will then regurgitate the bones and waste matter in a ball of black mucous. Inside this mucous you will likely find the entire skeleton of its prey. Norma goes to the front of the room and lowers a SCREEN.
I'm going to show you a film about the digestive process of the owl, and how the owl pellet is formed. The classroom whispers with excitement.
Arthur pulls through the ENTRANCE GATE at the NASA LANGLE RESEARCH CENTER. He retrieves his BADGE from the dashboar and shows it to the guard.  oo 13.

Arthur's car drives down MAIN STREET on the campus of the research center. The buildings are predominately drab, functional, one story brick structures.. surrounded by Yarious GLOBE STRUCTURES and PIPE NETWORKS on manicured g lawns.

The CAMERA tracks with Arthur as he moves through the cro corridor of one of the research buildings. He says hello various colleagues along the way. All of the men at the facility are dressed the same... wi white shirts and TIES and POCKET PROTECTOR BADGES. The pl resembles an all-male community college for young scienti

Arthur eases his way into the small, crowded AUDITORIUM t serves as a MEDIA ROOM. A PRESS CONFERENCE is underway. NORM CAHILL (40s), the VIKING PROJECT COORDINATOR, is standing at the podium. Next to him is an OVERHEAD PROJEC with maps and various schematics projected from it onto a LARGE SCREEN.

It’s been five months since the Viking lander touched down on the surface of Mars. We've seen dozens of photographs of the rock covered surface... what can you now tell us about the tests you’ve been conducting? Is there any sign of life on the red planet? Arthur takes a seat in the back of the auditorium. y

Well... there are three separate tests that we’ve been conducting... Pyrolytic Release, Labeled Release and Gas Exchange. The first two tests, based on soil samples about 22 centimeters deep, came back negative... and the third is... still pending. Cahill smiles. Laughter erupts from various parts of the auditorium.  14.
Can you elaborate on test number three? Cahill places a transparent MAP of the mars surface on th overhead projector and begins to draw on it with a WAX PENCIL.
The gas exchange experiment measures the production or uptake of C02, nitrogen, methane, hydrogen, and oxygen during the incubation of the martian soil sample.
Are you showing us all of the photos? Are there little green men up there? Laughter from the press.

Well... there is a possibility that the planet abounds with chemical compounds produced by living systems. Their chemical nature, distribution and structural uniqueness could be used to argue the presence of microscopic living organisms on Mars. As Cahill moves on to the next question... Arthur taps th reporter on the shoulder.

It all comes down to water. Arthur points to an OVERHEAD SATELLITE PHOTO of Utopia Planitia, a raised level of martian terrain in the vicini of the site where VIKING II landed. There are dry river-bed formations in the soil.

Tf we find water beneath the surface... and the topographic maps of Utopia Planitia indicate that there were once rivers on the surface of the planet, it’s possible that we‘ll eventually find evidence of life.  15.

The OWL PELLET FILM is underway. Norma sits in the back o the class next to the projector. She crosses her legs... reaching for her foot... massaging it gently. She cringes clearly in intense pain. Charles looks back at her... noticing this. They make eye contact... and Charles turns back to the screen. INT. NASA LANGLEY FACILITY -- CAHILL’S OFFICE -- MORNING Arthur now sits across from Cahill in his office. Behind is a window that overlooks a huge laboratory.
I’m sorry Arthur, but they’ve denied your application to be admitted into the astronaut program. Arthur looks crushed.
I see. (beat) Can I ask why?
I’m sorry, son... but they don’t tell us why.

The CAMERA tracks through a LARGE LABORATORY in the heart one of the main buildings on the Langley campus. Work tables assembled with LABORATORY EQUIPMENT and MACHI extend out into infinity as DOZENS OF YOUNG MEN, all dres in similar white shirts with NASA ID BADGES move througho engaged in various tasks. Arthur is standing at a LABORATORY TABLE with a WHITE MAS on. He is wearing a LAB COAT and GLASSES. He pours PINK LIQUID onto the surface of a METAL PAN... filling it to the edges. A colleague named WENDELL JAMES (29) walks over to see wh he is doing.  16.
Are they really with-holding some of the Mars photos?
I don't know, man. Jesus... what’s that smell?
It's a salinic compound.
What are you making?

Christmas present for Norma. Arthur retrieves a WHITE CERAMIC MOLD. The mold has an extrusion that is shaped like a WOMAN’S FOOT... only the of the foot is round and missing its toes, save for the P TOE.
A new prosthesis for her foot?
Yep. Arthur carefully impresses the MOLD of his wife's foot in the pink goop... sealing the mold at the edges into the t
What did you change up this time?
The compound they’re developing for the pilot chairs on the space shuttle.

INSERT: The BONES of a FIELD MOUSE have been re-assembled rough form within the tray... as the OWL PELLET has been ripped apart. The tray belongs to Charles, and he has grown tired of dissecting the owl pellet. He looks up to the head of the class and sees that Norma sitting up on her desk... filing her nails... waiting out last remaining minutes of the period.
Mrs. Lewis?  17. She raises her head.
Hmmm?
What happened to your foot? She just stares at him.
What happened... to my foot?

Yeah. (beat) My friend... she saw you take your shoe off. She said... that there's something wrong with it. The whole class goes silent. Norma begins to blush. She l down at her right foot, hidden inside of a CLOSED-TOE SHO
Well... it’s a long story. She looks at her watch.
We've got five minutes until second period. She looks back at her class and sees that their curiosity been piqued. She has no choice now but to tell them.
Alright... I’11 tell you what happened to my foot.
Arthur sits at the table with Wendell... waiting for the to dry. Arthur is dealing a deck of cards as they begin a game of GIN RUMMY.
When she was seventeen... still living in Texas, her brother dropped a barbell on her foot... broke three of her toes.  18.
The CAMERA pans across the faces of STUDENTS as they list to her tell the story.
And so I go to see the doctor. He goes to take an X-ray of my foot to see if the bones are broken.
Arthur discards... then retrieves a replacement card from stack.
So this dumb-ass Richmond doctor takes the x-ray... then he goes to check on another patient down the hall. Arthur discards a king.
This dumb-ass... he left the x-ray machine on.
Jesus. That’s not good.

Norma raises up her right shoe to show the class. NORMA. They found out that the tissue in four of my toes had been completely destroyed by the radiation. Norma swivels around on the desk and places her right foo against her left inner thigh.

So they have to amputate four of my toes. And then they had to take a bunch of skin from my inner thigh to cover the front of my foot. This is back in 1963... so they didn't have the skin graft techniques they do now.  19.
Arthur stands up and takes his RIGHT FOOT... pulls it up touches it to his LEFT INNER THIGH.
She had to sit there in a hospital bed in the same position for six months, waiting for it to heal. Wendell stares at the mold on the laboratory table.
Jesus. I hope she sued this idiot.
Oh yeah. Her family sued. They won.
What was the settlement?
Forty thousand dollars. Arthur pulls the ceramic mold out of the pink goop... and see the IMPRESSION of her disfigured foot inside the new PROSTHESIS.
Norma turns around and uncrosses her legs. They now dangl over the edge of the lab desk.
You guys want to see it? Now that the secret is out... I don’t want you spreading rumors about my mangled foot. The class responds enthusiastically.

Come on... gather round... take a look at the freak show. As the kids gather around... Norma removes her right shoe reveals her disfigured foot... missing every toe but her pinky. A rounded piece of SCAR TISSUE covers the rest of  20.
Arthur takes the trimmed PROSTHESIS and wraps it in tissu paper, then places it in a CARDBOARD BOX with a red bow o it.
If this sucker works... she can start jogging again. :
Dana walks up to Walter as he stands in front of his lock
I’m sorry I said that her foot looked gross.
It doesn’t look gross... it looks cool. And if you can’t tell the difference between gross and cool... then I feel sorry for you, Dana. Walter walks off... leaving her alone.
Norma emerges from her car carrying GROCERY BAGS in both arms. Walter comes out of the garage with his bike.
Hey honey.
Why do I need a baby-sitter?
Because you're nine years old. You’re not a geezer yet.
It's 1976, mom. Times are changing. Nine years old isn't what it used to be. I think I’m ready to get a moped.
We're not buying you a moped, Walter. Stick with the bike... and be home before dark.  2l.
Fine. Walter rides off down the street.
Norma comes into the foyer, groceries in hand. The PHONE ringing.
Norma comes into the kitchen, sets the groceries down on kitchen table. She grabs the phone off the wall and puts to her ear.
Hello? There is silence on the other end of the line.
Hello? A MOMENT OF SILENCE... then the caller disconnects. Norma hangs up the phone and starts unloading the groceri The box sits on the table... but she takes no notice of i
Arthur emerges from a NASA CAMPUS GYMNASIUM into the twil with Wendell. Both are covered in sweat, dressed in gym clothes. Arthur is carrying his BASKETBALL and a gym bag.
How's the commute back to Richmond?
Not too bad. Maybe an hour and twenty minutes.

Tell Norma I said hello. Wendell watches him walk across the lawn to the parking lot... approaching his car. He lights a cigarette and tak drag... then looks at his watch. INSERT: His watch shows that it is 4:58 PM.  22.
Norma sits on the couch... smoking a CIGARETTE. On the TELEVISION... the LOCAL NEWS is playing. The DOORBELL rings.
Norma opens the front door. A man named ARLINGTON STEWARD (40) is standing there, his body is turned in profile. He is wearing a crisp wool sui and a BLACK HAT, with a BRIEFCASE in his right hand.
Mrs. Lewis?
Yeah.

My name is Arlington Steward. Her eyes light up, as she remembers the name and the box. Arlington then rotates his body... revealing the RIGHT SI of his face. Norma's eyes widen in horror at what she see Nearly all of the right side of his face from his cheekbo to his lower jaw has been burned away. His rear MOLARS an GUMS are exposed beneath the absence of tissue that is supposed to conceal them. Norma immediately feels a strange connection... a deep sympathy for him and the pain he must have endured.
I assume you received the box that I left on your doorstep. His speech has a slight impediment from the burn that ext to the right side of his mouth.
Oh, yes. Yes we did.
And you retrieved the button unit inside of the box. Norma smiles. He smiles back at her.  23.
The button unit. That‘’s what you call it?
Indeed. May I come in?
Sure. Norma turns and leads him back into the kitchen. She retrieves the button unit from the table.
So what it this thing? I assume you're trying to sell me something?
Well... in a way, yes. I do have an offer to make.
Yeah? What are you selling?
A financial opportunity. ‘Arlington gestures toward the table with his briefcase.

May I? She nods. He places the briefcase down on the table. He takes the button unit from her and sets it down on the kitchen table. They both sit down. He then withdraws a SMALL YELLOW ENVELOPE from his suit jacket pocket.
Inside of this envelope is a key. Arlington opens the envelope and withdraws a small METAL

This is the key that opens the glass dome of the button unit. Arlington then inserts the key into a small HORIZONTAL SL at the top edge. He turns the key, and the LID that house the GLASS DOME pops lose. The METAL BUTTON is now exposed.  24.
If you push the button, one of two things will happen. (beat) First, someone... somewhere in the world... who you do not know... will die. Norma just stares at him.
Then, you will receive a payment of two-hundred thousand dollars... tax free. Arlington opens the briefcase. Inside are neatly stacked of ONE-HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS.
The money will be delivered to you in cash. Norma covers her mouth... shocked at the sight of so much money. NORMA. Are you for real? Arlington smiles back at her.
Mrs. Lewis, I can assure you that the offer is real.
Who do you work for?

The guarantee of payment has several restrictions. One... I am not permitted to disclose any information about to the identity of my employers. (beat) Two... if you discuss the details of this financial opportunity with anyone other than your husband, the offer is null and void, and you will not receive the money in return for having pushed the button. (beat) Three... you have twenty four hours. Arlington glances at his watch.  25.

You have until five o'clock tomorrow evening to make your decision whether or not to push the button. At that time, I will return to retrieve the button unit from you. It will be re-programmed and the offer will be made to someone else. Arlington places the key back into the envelope, seals it with crisp precision, and hands it over to her. He then closes the briefcase and stands up to leave.
Until then... a good day to you, Mrs. Lewis. He nods his head and turns toward the foyer.
She follows him toward the front door.
Wait a minute... you're just going to leave me with this thing. (baffled) Is this some kind of joke? Who are you? He opens the front door and turns back to her with a frie smile.

My name is Arlington Steward, and I can assure you that this is no joke. The offer is real, but I am not at liberty to disclose any more information than I already have. He withdraws a BUSINESS CARD and hands it to her.
Good day. He heads down the walk towarc his car. She looks down at the card and sees that his name is prin in an embossed BLACK FONT:
She turns the card over and sees what looks like a PHONE NUMBER printed on the back: 8047941779 She stands there in the doorway and watches him step into automobile, start the engine and drive off.
Walter is sitting on a bench in front of a line of shops CARYTOWN. Dana approaches him. He turns to face her.
What do you want?
I’m sorry. I just wanted to tell you... that I think your mom is beautiful. Walter just stares at her in silence... wanting to forgiv her.

Norma walks back into the kitchen, holding the key envelo in one hand and the business card in the other. She stares at them both, then down at the box. She then retrieves the key from the envelope and inserts it into t slot, opening the glass dome. She stares at the button for a long moment... then closes dome. She closes her eyes... crying to make sense of what just transpired.
The CAMERA zooms out from a RINGING PHONE that sits on a KITCHEN COUNTER in a large suburban house. SUSAN BURNS (5 goes to answer the phone.
Hello?
Hey mom.
Hey honey. What's up?  27.
Nothing... I just... The CAMERA continues to zoom out, revealing her husband, BURNS (50s) laid out in a recliner, watching television.
Is something wrong?
Norma stares at the business card.
No... something just happened and...
What?
Nothing. I don’t want to talk about it right now.
Susan carries the phone into the family room
Alright. (covering the phone) Jim... you gotta get ready.
Alright. He sits up and moves toward the stairs.
Wait until you see the spread tonight.
Norma twirls the phone cord around her finger.
Hmmm. I think they're spending more on their wedding than we did on our house.
Is your foot acting up again?  28. Norma leans against the wall... Lifting her right foot of the floor to ease the pain,
A little, yeah. That damn bone. The skin from my leg, it’s not as tough as it should be.
You know he's gonna be there tonight. NORMA. Who?
Dr. Stupid. Norma takes this in... remembering...

Well... it’s been what... thirteen years? Bound to run into each other at some point, right? INT. LEWIS HOUSE -- MASTER BATHROOM -— LATER ON Norma is now wearing only her BRA AND PANTIES, her hair a make-up flawless. She finishes putting on a pair of DIAMO EARRINGS . As she steps into an elegant COCKTAIL DRESS... we see the deep square shaped SCARS on the inside of her LEFT THIGH. INT. LEWIS HOUSE -- MASTER BEDROOM -— NEXT Norma comes into the bedroom... and ARTHUR is there... putting on his CUFF LINKS. He is dressed in a TUXEDO. His jacket is laid out on the bed, and next to it is his CHRISTMAS PRESENT. Norma sees it.
What's this?
A little gift from Dr. Rex Morgan. She opens the present and retrieves the PROSTHESIS.
Oh my god!  29. Norma removes an old, store-bought INSOLE from her right and inserts the new one.

It's a material they developed for the new shuttle chairs. It’ll absorb the pressure of your foot and re-distribute it across the entire surface areé. She then slides her disfigured foot into the shoe... and begins to walk around the room.
Oh my God, Rex... how’d you do it?
I just figured out a way to make it better. She crosses the room and gives him a hug and a kiss.
I don’t know what I'd do without you.
Merry Christmas, June.
Norma and Arthur come into the family room, wearing their winter coats. Walter is sitting across the coffee table w Dana. They are playing CARDS. The box is sitting between them.
Did Mr. Steward show up? Norma sees the box sitting there and immediately grabs it the table.
Yeah... what's it all about. Did he show up?
Yeah... I'1]1 tell you about it in the car. We're running late. Norma leans down and kisses Walter on the cheek.  30.
We'll be home late... your bedtime is ten. Dana watches them go... her eyes transfixed on the box in Norma's hands.
The CAMERA tracks with Arthur’s car as it drives south on CARY STREET... approaching an intersection. INT. ARTHUR’S CAR -- NEXT Norma has the box sitting in her lap while Arthur drives.
And before I could ask him anything else... he got in his car... and he pulled off. ARTHUR . Did you get the license plate?
No.
Your dad is cop, Norma. Always get the license plate number.
I was little overwhelmed, Arthur.
Somewhere in the world... someone you do not know will die.
Those were his exact words.
Did he say how they would die?
No.
And he showed you the cash.
